definitions.definition: an element, feature, or factor that is liable to vary or change.
examples: there are too many variables involved to make any meaningful predictions
synonyms: condition "there are other variables to consider"

definitions.definition: a quantity that during a calculation is assumed to vary or be capable of varying in value.
a data item that may take on more than one value during the runtime of a program.
the region of light, variable winds to the north of the northeast trade winds or (in the southern hemisphere) between the southeast trade winds and the westerlies.
